flawed_nl_solution:
Mark has 10 fewer cards than Michael so Mark has 100 cards - 10 cards = 120 cards.
So, Lloyd has 120 cards / 3 = <<120/3=40>>40 cards.
All three of them have 120 cards + 40 cards + 100 cards = <<120+40+100=260>>260 cards.
Thus, they need to collect 300 cards - 260 cards = <<300-260=40>>40 more cards.
#### 40

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 120. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
